title: Pregnant mum in hospital after being thrown on stomach by shopping centre guards

A heavily pregnant woman was rushed to hospital with contractions after she was tackled by the security guards at a shopping mall.

Octavia Stitts, who is at 36 weeks pregnant, was at the mall in Wisconsin, USA, after learning that her 15-year-old daughter has been detained by police there.

Video circulated on social media shows a large group of teens following Octavia's daughter and later assaulting her in front of the Forever 21 shop.

It's said mall security intervened and detained the daughter and her younger cousin.

Octavia told Weau News : "My baby said they tackled her to the ground. I just broke down and cried when I saw that whole crowd attack my baby.

"They had my baby and her little cousin handcuffed. My baby was complaining about how tight the handcuffs were."

She tried to step in but the security guards tackled her and pinned her to the ground.

Another video shows Octavia, wearing striped jumpsuit, was resisting when at least two guards held onto her limbs.

The incident has caused her early contractions and she had to be rushed to the hospital.

She explained while she's on the stretcher: "I'm in the hospital right now because security threw me on my stomach several times and tackled me down.

"It's not cool. I could have lost my unborn to some nonsense me and my child had nothing to do with."

She was not arrested and later released from the hospital.

The Mayfair Mall where the drama unfolded issued a statement following the incident.

It read: "There is nothing more important than providing our community with a safe, peaceful shopping environment.

"This is a developing police investigation led by the Wauwatosa Police Department, and we are directing all inquiries to them.

"However, we can confirm that the individuals involved were disruptive, uncooperative and became physically assaultive towards our security officers."
description: Octavia Stitts said she was pinned to the ground by security guards outside a Forever 21 store in Wisconsin, US
